data.name: Crypto 101
data.text: Invest only what you can afford to lose in cryptocurrencies. It's important to do your research and diversify your portfolio. Be mindful of scams and avoid investing in unknown projects.

data.name: Blockchain Basics
data.text: Blockchain is a decentralized digital ledger that records transactions in a secure and transparent manner. It is the underlying technology behind cryptocurrencies and has many other applications. The data on a blockchain cannot be altered or deleted once it is recorded.

questions.text: What is the benefit of using blockchain?
Can the data on a blockchain be altered or deleted?

data.name: Crypto Basics
data.text: Cryptocurrencies are digital assets that are designed to work as a medium of exchange. Unlike traditional currencies, they are not backed by a government or financial institution. Cryptocurrencies are decentralized and operate on a blockchain, a distributed ledger technology that provides transparency and security.

questions.text: How are cryptocurrencies different from traditional currencies?
What technology do cryptocurrencies operate on?

data.name: Investing in Cryptocurrencies
data.text: Investing in cryptocurrencies can be risky and volatile. It's important to do your research and only invest what you can afford to lose. Consider factors like market trends, regulatory environment, and the underlying technology of the cryptocurrency before investing.

questions.text: What should you consider before investing in cryptocurrencies?
How much should you invest in cryptocurrencies?

answers.text: Only what you can afford to lose
